definitions.definition: All the classical traditions of the art and architecture of ancient Greece and Rome, especially the aspects of simplicity, elegance and proportion.
Classical scholarship.
A Latin or Ancient Greek expression used in an English sentence.
Divination about human affairs or natural phenomena from the relative positions of celestial bodies.
Cold, chilly.
definitions.example: I'd like a frosty milkshake.

definitions.definition: Having frost on it.
definitions.example: The frosty pumpkin is the sign of the end of the growing season, soon the greenery will wither and harvest end for the year.

definitions.definition: Having an aloof or inhospitable manner.
definitions.example: After the divorce, she was civil but frosty to her ex.

definitions.definition: A party held for a woman who is about to be married.

A typically non-interactive portion of cinematic narrative shown during a video game to advance the story. Cut scenes may be presented with full motion video or may be done with the game engine, in which case they may allow some interactivity.
A tool, such as a cane, used to ease pressure on the legs, and to aid stability, when walking.
A stick insect (order Phasmida).
A playing card with the rank of seven.
The aurora of the northern hemisphere.
Extensively damaged as the result of war.
A poll organized in an attempt to quantify public opinion on a subject.
A cradlesong, a soothing song to calm children or lull them to sleep.
To sing a lullaby to.
(usually used in the passive) To offend slightly.
To become slightly offended.
Somewhat indignant, irritated, angry, put out or annoyed.
A building where people meet for a purpose.
A building where a Quaker congregation assembles for worship.
A shape resembling the letter v
definitions.example: The impact was so strong, it bent the bar into a v.

definitions.definition: Very.
definitions.example: You were acting v rude to his boyfriend on New Year's.

definitions.definition: Against; in opposition to.
definitions.example: It is the Packers versus the Steelers in the Super Bowl.

definitions.definition: Compared with, as opposed to.

Bringing a legal action against, as used in the title of a court case in which the first party indicates the plaintiff (or appellant or the like), and the second indicates the defendant (or respondent or the like).
definitions.example: Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, Kans.

definitions.definition: A cute person or animal.
A clementine: a small, waxy-peeled orange hybrid cultivar that is easy to peel by hand.
(by extension) Any small mandarin orange variety such as a tangerine or a satsuma.
A road giving entry to a region or, especially, to a motorway.
(more localised) A road giving access to a particular place.
A consonant having a hissing sound such as the 's' or 'sh' in 'sash' or 'surge'.
Characterized by a hissing sound such as the "s" or "sh" in sash or surge.
A soft garment, usually knit or woven, worn on the foot and lower leg under shoes or other footwear.
definitions.example: a pair of stockings

definitions.definition: A broad ring of a different fur colour on the lower part of the leg of a quadruped.
A knitted hood of cotton thread which is eventually converted by a special process into an incandescent mantle for gas lighting.
To have on hand for sale.
definitions.example: The store stocks all kinds of dried vegetables.

definitions.definition: To provide with material requisites; to store; to fill; to supply.
definitions.example: to stock a farm, i.e. to supply it with cattle and tools

definitions.definition: To allow (cows) to retain milk for twenty-four hours or more prior to sale.
To put in the stocks as punishment.
To fit (an anchor) with a stock, or to fasten the stock firmly in place.
To arrange cards in a certain manner for cheating purposes; to stack the deck.
A ratio of the actual density of trees in an area to the ideal density that would make the fullest use of the land.
Accepting of one's legal or moral obligations and willing to do them well, and without complaint.
definitions.example: Ralph was a dutiful child, and took the trash out without being told.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to one's duty; demonstrative of one's sense of duty.
To make quiet; to calm; to reduce to a state of peace; to dispel (anger or hatred).
definitions.example: to appease the tumult of the ocean

definitions.definition: To come to terms with; to adapt to the demands of.
definitions.example: They appeased the angry gods with burnt offerings.

definitions.definition: A form of entertainment in the United States that combines a restaurant meal with a staged play or musical.
An establishment that features dinner theater, and contains a live theater, a restaurant, and, usually, a bar.
An Islamic garment that covers the whole body, which has a net screen covering the eyes so they cannot be seen, and is worn by women.
A dress made from felt or karakul (the short curly fur of young lambs of the breed of that name), traditionally worn by men of the Caucasus region.
Thinly sliced raw beef or tuna, usually served as an appetizer.
The pungent, spicy fresh or dried fruit of any of several cultivated varieties of capsicum peppers, used in cooking.
Powdered chili pepper, used as a spice or flavouring in cooking.
(Indian Chinese cuisine) a spicy stew of chicken or paneer, capsicum and onion, eaten as an appetizer.
A dish made with chili peppers and other ingredients, such as beans and beef.
(Cincinnati) Cincinnati chili.
To fly over something.
definitions.example: My family planned to take pictures from the ground as I overflew them in the hot air balloon.

definitions.definition: To fly too far past something.
definitions.example: The small size of the airstrip meant that pilots would frequently overfly and have to circle back.

definitions.definition: Delicious; delectable.
definitions.example: What a scrumptious treat!

definitions.definition: Picky; fastidious.
A typically black formal jacket worn by men.
The entire suit complementing and including this jacket.
To prearrange unalterably.
To decree.
To admit into the ministry of a religion, for example as a priest, bishop, minister or Buddhist monk, or to authorize as a rabbi.
To predestine.
A traditional wedding ceremony, typically in a church, in which the bride wears a white wedding dress, symbolic of her virginity.
A confounding variable.
To perplex or puzzle.
To fail to see the difference; to mix up; to confuse right and wrong.
To make something worse.
definitions.example: Don't confound the situation by yelling.

definitions.definition: To combine in a confused fashion; to mingle so as to make the parts indistinguishable.
To cause to be ashamed; to abash.
definitions.example: His actions confounded the skeptics.

definitions.definition: To defeat, to frustrate, to thwart.
To damn (a mild oath).
definitions.example: Confound the lady!

definitions.definition: To bring to ruination.
To stun, amaze
To make equal; to cause to correspond in amount or degree.
definitions.example: to equalize accounts, burdens, or taxes

definitions.definition: To be equal to; to equal, to rival.
To make the scoreline equal by scoring points.
(underwater diving) To clear the ears to balance the pressure in the middle ear with the outside pressure by letting air enter along the Eustachian tubes.
Said of a morphism: to pre-compose with each of a parallel pair of morphisms so as to yield the same composite morphism.
A light covering with a sprinkled substance.
definitions.example: He decorated the Christmas card with a sprinkle of glitter.

definitions.definition: A light rain shower.
An aspersorium or utensil for sprinkling.
To cause (a substance) to fall in fine drops (for a liquid substance) or small pieces (for a solid substance).
definitions.example: The confectioner sprinkled icing sugar over the cakes.

definitions.definition: To cover (an object) by sprinkling a substance on to it.
definitions.example: The confectioner sprinkled the cakes with icing sugar.

definitions.definition: To drip in fine drops, sometimes sporadically.
definitions.example: It sprinkled outside all day long.

definitions.definition: To rain very lightly outside.
definitions.example: It sprinkled very early in the morning.

definitions.definition: To baptize by the application of a few drops, or a small quantity, of water; hence, to cleanse; to purify.
Tasting of salt.
Containing salt.
Coarse, provocative, earthy; said of language.
Experienced, especially used to indicate a veteran of the naval services; salty dog (from salt of the sea).
Irritated, annoyed (from the sharp, spicy flavor of salt).

Indignant or offended due to over-sensitivity, humourlessness, disappointment, or defeat (implying the person is a crybaby, shedding salty tears); said of interlocutors expressing indignation, or merely disagreement.

Pertaining to the Sardinian language and those dialects of Catalan, spoken in the Balearic Islands and along the coast of Catalonia, that use definitive articles descended from the Latin ipse instead of the Latin ille.
Again and again; repeatedly; every time; always
definitions.example: Time after time he tries, and time after time, he fails.

definitions.definition: (narrowly) Belief that no deities exist (sometimes including rejection of other religious beliefs).
(broadly) Rejection of belief that any deities exist (with or without a belief that no deities exist).
(very broadly) Absence of belief that any deities exist (including absence of the concept of deities).
Absence of belief in a particular deity, pantheon, or religious doctrine (notwithstanding belief in other deities).
Ancient times; faraway history; former ages
definitions.example: Cicero was an eloquent orator of antiquity.

definitions.definition: The people of ancient times.
definitions.example: That such pillars were raised by Seth all antiquity has avowed. —Sir W. Raleigh.

definitions.definition: An old gentleman.
definitions.example: You are a shrewd antiquity, neighbor Clench. —B. Jonson.

definitions.definition: (history) The historical period preceding the Middle Ages (c. 500-1500), primarily relating to European history.
(often constructed as an uncountable plural) A relic or monument of ancient times, such as a coin, a statue, etc.; an ancient institution.
The state of being ancient or of ancient lineage.
Full of emotion and vigor.
Full of soul.
Enough to fill one's soul.
To cross from one side to another of (gender, sex or something in that vein).
In (or constituting, forming, or describing) a double bond in which the greater radical on both ends is on the opposite side of the bond.
Of the side of the Golgi apparatus farther from the endoplasmic reticulum.
(sometimes offensive, sometimes humorous) A trans person.
Transgender (or sometimes transsexual).
definitions.example: trans rights are human rights

definitions.definition: Non-cisgender; an umbrella term encompassing transgender, transsexual, and often also genderqueer/nonbinary, genderfluid, third-gender, etc — all gender identities other than cisgender.
The act of conducting or carrying out (business, negotiations, plans).
definitions.example: The transaction was made on Friday with the supplier.

definitions.definition: A deal or business agreement.
An exchange or trade, as of ideas, money, goods, etc.
definitions.example: I made the transaction with the vendor as soon as she showed me the pearls.

definitions.definition: The transfer of funds into, out of, or from an account.
An atomic operation; a message, data modification, or other procedure that is guaranteed to perform completely or not at all (e.g. a database transaction).
(especially in plural) A record of the proceedings of a learned society.
(in transactional analysis) A social interaction.
The act of transmitting, e.g. data or electric power.
The fact of being transmitted.
Something that is transmitted, such as a message, picture or a disease; the sending of such a thing.
The passage of a nerve impulse across synapses.
An assembly of gears through which power is transmitted from the engine to the driveshaft in a motor car / automobile; a gearbox.

The right possessed by an heir or legatee of transmitting to his successor(s) any inheritance, legacy, right, or privilege, to which he is entitled, even if he should die without enjoying or exercising it.
(medicine, biology) The passing of a communicable disease from an infected host individual or group to a conspecific individual or group.
(sometimes offensive, sometimes humorous) A trans person.
The act of transmitting, e.g. data or electric power.
The fact of being transmitted.
Something that is transmitted, such as a message, picture or a disease; the sending of such a thing.
The passage of a nerve impulse across synapses.
An assembly of gears through which power is transmitted from the engine to the driveshaft in a motor car / automobile; a gearbox.

The right possessed by an heir or legatee of transmitting to his successor(s) any inheritance, legacy, right, or privilege, to which he is entitled, even if he should die without enjoying or exercising it.
(medicine, biology) The passing of a communicable disease from an infected host individual or group to a conspecific individual or group.
The act of washing dishes etc; dishwashing.
definitions.example: I'll do the washing-up if you put it all away.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to washing dishes.
definitions.example: This washing-up liquid is kinder to my hands than that one.

definitions.definition: The act of reducing one's spending.
A sleeveless dress, often similar to an apron, generally worn over other clothes. Most often worn by young girls as an overdress.
A piece of vegetable, or sometimes meat, deep-fried in a batter flavoured with spices.
A type of self-hypnotic relaxation technique developed by German psychiatrist Johannes Heinrich Schultz.
Please, kindly; used in giving a non-concrete instruction.
definitions.example: But imagine, if you like, a world where climate change did not exist.

definitions.definition: So to speak, like; used to indicate that a description is not standard.
definitions.example: This band's genre can be described as, if you like, New Wave or Post-Punk.

definitions.definition: Confident in one's own abilities.
A small burrowing rodent, especially in the family Geomyidae.
The gopher tortoise.
The gopher rockfish.
A worker who runs errands; an errand boy.
A vote for something that increases a cumulative tally of popularity.
To vote for, increasing a cumulative tally of popularity.
Having difficulty hearing; somewhat deaf.
definitions.example: Speak loudly, because Grandpa is somewhat hard of hearing.

definitions.definition: A large floating mass of ice; pack ice.
A pack of crushed ice applied to the body in order to reduce pain or inflammation.
A plastic sac of silicone that can be cooled in a freezer and then used in a cool bag, cool box or cooler; a freezer block
To take part in paragliding.
The sport of gliding with a paraglider.
The use of a paraglider in other settings, such as surveillance or military applications.
A daring or dangerous feat, often involving the display of gymnastic skills.
Skill
A special means of rushing the quarterback done to confuse the opposing team's offensive line.
(cheerleading) To perform a stunt.
To show off; to posture.
A check in growth.
That which has been checked in growth; a stunted animal or thing.
A two-year-old whale, which, having been weaned, is lean and yields little blubber.
To check or hinder the growth or development of.
definitions.example: Some have said smoking stunts your growth.

definitions.definition: A peppermint-flavoured liqueur.
A rectangular, box-shaped bed with handles, in which a baby can be carried while asleep.
To flow in a continuous or steady manner, like a liquid.
To extend; to stretch out with a wavy motion; to float in the wind.
definitions.example: A flag streams in the wind.

definitions.definition: To discharge in a stream.
definitions.example: The soldier's wound was streaming blood.

definitions.definition: To push continuous data (e.g. music) from a server to a client computer while it is being used (played) on the client.
Flowing or moving in continuous succession, like fluid in a stream.
Movement as a stream.
The transmission of digital audio or video, or the reception or playback of such data without first storing it.
Division of classes into academic streams.
The working of alluvial deposits to get ore.
A competitor thought unlikely to win.
Somebody at a disadvantage.
A high swing wherein the person pushing the swing runs beneath the swing while the person being pushed is at the forward limit of the arc.
The action of cutting, surgery or other invasive treatment of a living organism for the purposes of physiological or pathological scientific investigation.
A professional poet and singer, like among the ancient Celts, whose occupation was to compose and sing verses in honor of the heroic achievements of princes and brave men.
(by extension) A poet.
definitions.example: Shakespeare is known as the bard of Avon.

definitions.definition: A piece of defensive (or, sometimes, ornamental) armor for a horse's neck, breast, and flanks; a barb. (Often in the plural.)
Defensive armor formerly worn by a man at arms.
A thin slice of fat bacon used to cover any meat or game.
The exterior covering of the trunk and branches of a tree; the rind.
Specifically, Peruvian bark.
To cover a horse in defensive armor.
To cover (meat or game) with a thin slice of fat bacon.
A loose filmy mass or a thin chiplike layer of anything
definitions.example: There were a few flakes of paint on the floor from when we were painting the walls.

definitions.definition: A scale of a fish or similar animal
A prehistoric tool chipped out of stone.
A person who is impractical, flighty, unreliable, or inconsistent; especially with maintaining a living.
definitions.example: She makes pleasant conversation, but she's kind of a flake when it comes time for action.

definitions.definition: A carnation with only two colours in the flower, the petals having large stripes.
A flat turn or tier of rope.
To break or chip off in a flake.
definitions.example: The paint flaked off after only a year.

definitions.definition: To prove unreliable or impractical; to abandon or desert, to fail to follow through.
definitions.example: He said he'd come and help, but he flaked.

definitions.definition: To store an item such as rope or sail in layers
definitions.example: The line is flaked into the container for easy attachment and deployment.

definitions.definition: To hit (another person).
Dogfish.
The meat of the gummy shark.
Something which is not genuine, or is presented fraudulently.
A trick; a swindle.
A move meant to deceive an opposing player, used for gaining advantage for example when dribbling an opponent.
One of the circles or windings of a cable or hawser, as it lies in a coil; a single turn or coil.
A paling; a hurdle.
A platform of hurdles, or small sticks made fast or interwoven, supported by stanchions, for drying codfish and other things.
A small stage hung over a vessel's side, for workmen to stand on while calking, etc.
A two-wheeled carriage pulled along by a person.
To move someone by means of a rickshaw.
Of holiday accommodation: in which the holidaymaker cooks for him/herself.
A single telephone line which is shared by two or more households.
The official policy of a political party or other organization.
definitions.example: The party line is that the exploding widgets are a result of user error.

definitions.definition: A pith helmet.
To undergo a weigh-in.
definitions.example: His trailer weighed in lighter than it should have. He might have a leak.

definitions.definition: To subject to a weigh-in.
definitions.example: They had to weigh him in at the loading dock.

definitions.definition: (with "at") To weigh.
definitions.example: He weighs in at upwards of 250 pounds.

definitions.definition: To bring in one's weight, metaphorically speaking, to bear on an issue; frequently construed with on or with.
definitions.example: Everyone spoke freely, until the boss weighed in.

definitions.definition: An area of low, wet land, often with tall grass.
A species of onion (Allium fistulosum) from Asia, with slender bulbs.
Any of several similar types of onion.
Engine layout in motor vehicles where only the rear wheels are driven.
To overcome, quieten, or bring under control.
To bring (a country) under control by force.
Conquered; overpowered; crushed; submissive.
definitions.example: He is subdued after the disagreement last night.

definitions.definition: Not glaring in color; soft and light in tone.
definitions.example: The colour scheme used for this room is subdued.

definitions.definition: Any of various wading birds of the family Charadriidae.
To become larger, to increase in magnitude.
definitions.example: Children grow quickly.

definitions.definition: To appear or sprout.
definitions.example: A long tail began to grow from his backside.

definitions.definition: To develop, to mature.
definitions.example: As I grew throughout adolescence, I came to appreciate many things about human nature.

definitions.definition: To cause or allow something to become bigger, especially to cultivate plants.
definitions.example: Have you ever grown your hair before?

definitions.definition: To assume a condition or quality over time.
definitions.example: The boy grew wise as he matured.

definitions.definition: To become attached or fixed; to adhere.
Growth; increase
(attributive) Connected with growing
definitions.example: The growing season here begins in March.

definitions.definition: That grows.
definitions.example: Milk is good for growing children.

definitions.definition: A wind blowing across a line of travel.
A purplish-red pigment, made from dye obtained from the cochineal beetle; carminic acid or any of its derivatives.
A purplish-red colour, resembling that pigment.
Of the purplish red colour shade carmine.
One who follows a method.
To vary irregularly; to swing.
To undulate.
To be irresolute; to waver.
definitions.example: I fluctuated between wishing he was back home and wishing I'd never met him.

definitions.definition: To cause to vary irregularly.
Any of various medium-sized water birds of the genus Gallinula, of the rail family, that feed in open water margins.
A female red grouse, Lagopus lagopus scotica.
A cut of quick-cured pork leg.
To cure bacon by salting.
A victory in backgammon achieved when the opponent has not borne off a single stone.
Backgammon (the game itself).
To beat by a gammon (without the opponent bearing off a stone).
A rope fastening a bowsprit to the stem of a ship (usually called a gammoning).
To lash with ropes (on a ship).
Chatter, ridiculous nonsense.
To deceive; to lie plausibly to.
A middle-aged or older right-wing, reactionary white man, or such men collectively.
Relating to respiration; breathing.
An apparent defeat that is in some important sense a real victory.
Any of the species of biennial thistles in the genus Arctium.
A device used for cutting grass to a chosen height, typically of landscaped lawns of residences or institutions.
definitions.example: We replaced our old electric lawnmower with a new cordless one.

definitions.definition: A person who landscapes and in particular mows lawns.
definitions.example: We hired a third lawnmower for the spring and summer.

definitions.definition: (preceded by definite article) A dance move in which the dancer mimics using a push mower by pulling the starter cord and then pushing the mower forwards.
The right to teach or learn freely without unreasonable interference from authority, or fear of reprisal.
The middle; the midst.
A middle way or manner; a mean or middle course between extremes.
The part of a fair or circus where rides, entertainments, and booths are concentrated.
The widest aisle in the middle of an industrial complex (such as railroad shops or a coach yard) along which various buildings are aligned
Being in the middle of the way or distance; middle.
Halfway; equidistant from either end point; in the middle between two points
A male bird, especially:
A valve or tap for controlling flow in plumbing.
The hammer of a firearm trigger mechanism.
The notch of an arrow or crossbow.
The penis.
The circle at the end of the rink.
The state of being cocked; an upward turn, tilt or angle.
A stupid person.
Nonsense; rubbish.
(Tasmania) Term of address.
definitions.example: All right, cock?

definitions.definition: A boastful tilt of one's head or hat.
Shuttlecock
A vane in the shape of a cock; a weathercock.
A chief man; a leader or master.
The crow of a cock, especially the first crow in the morning; cockcrow.
A male fish, especially a salmon or trout.
The style or gnomon of a sundial.
The indicator of a balance.
The bridge piece that affords a bearing for the pivot of a balance in a clock or watch.
To lift the cock of a firearm or crossbow; to prepare (a gun or crossbow) to be fired.
To be prepared to be triggered by having the cock lifted.
definitions.example: In the darkness, the gun cocked loudly.

definitions.definition: To erect; to turn up.
To copulate with.
To turn or twist something upwards or to one side; to lift or tilt (e.g. headwear) boastfully.
definitions.example: He cocked his hat jauntily.

definitions.definition: To turn (the eye) obliquely and partially close its lid, as an expression of derision or insinuation.
To strut; to swagger; to look big, pert, or menacing.
To make a nestle-cock of, to pamper or spoil (of children)
Expression of annoyance.
definitions.example: 2006, "Vamp", oh cock i should have kept with a toyota! (on newsgroup uk.rec.cars.modifications)

definitions.definition: (where it is still sometimes used) Vulva, vagina.
A small conical pile of hay.
definitions.example: The farmhands stack the hay into cocks

definitions.definition: To form into piles.
Abbreviation of cock-boat, a type of small boat.
A corruption of the word God, used in oaths.
To keep back; to retain.
definitions.example: We reserve the right to make modifications.

definitions.definition: To keep in store for future or special use.
definitions.example: This cake is reserved for the guests!

definitions.definition: To book in advance; to make a reservation.
definitions.example: I reserved a table for us at the best restaurant in town.

definitions.definition: To make an exception of; to except.
Slow to reveal emotion or opinions.
definitions.example: He was a quiet, reserved person.

definitions.definition: Set aside for a particular person or purpose.
definitions.example: I'm sorry, sir, but these are reserved seats.

definitions.definition: A photographic (or other) image in which the subject is shown at a relatively large scale, and occupies most or all of the frame.
Of or pertaining to things in near proximity or a situation involving nearness.
